title: Consumer preference : fiction versus non-fiction books in England 2013
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 4 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Mixture of both and lowest at Response Neither.
The highest Response Mixture of both has 36.0 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Neither.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Response Mixture of both has the highest Share of respondents and Neither has the lowest Share of respondents.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 4 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Mixture of both and lowest at Response Neither.
The highest Response Mixture of both has 36.0 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Neither.
max_summary: This bar chart has 4 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
Response Mixture of both has the highest Share of respondents and Neither has the lowest Share of respondents.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Response Fiction.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 36.0.
Response Mixture of both is higher than any other Responses with value 44.0, followed by Fiction, and Non-fiction. Down to Response Neither with the lowest value 8.0.
The Response Neither tends to be 1.76 percent lower than average.
Summing up the values of all Responses, we get total 100.0.
